name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Some pods are enormous. Some are open to an untold number of people’s germs through contacts of contacts (of contacts of contacts of contacts)." 

Smart, necessary piece from @rachgutman:
https://t.co/H0d4nV9smq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: “Just because we know bad things about the 45th president, don’t assume that there’s nothing bad left to find out…There’s always more to learn, and it’s seldom reassuring.” @TimothyNoah1 on the Trump we don’t yet know: https://t.co/NmOZ4hujTm

name: TheAtlantic
TheAtlantic
text: Those contesting the election "will likely face no real consequences for their actions—and if they do, those repercussions will not be enough to address the scale of the problem," @qjurecic writes: https://t.co/xIMReWLkNH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As unpalatable as it sometimes may seem," @jimgolby writes, "putting U.S. troops in harm’s way isn’t always about winning or solving problems. Sometimes it’s about managing risk—keeping minor problems from turning into major crises." https://t.co/irsNcoJna7

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: NEW from me - a look at Anita Dunn, the quiet but essential hand who guided Biden through ups and the downs of the campaign and won’t be going far even though she won’t be joining the White House: 
https://t.co/UGpwq2ILnF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: "One of the great geniuses of the Constitution is that the establishment of justice precedes ensuring domestic tranquility." 

My conversation w/ @RevDrBarber:  https://t.co/uZkwpFpLy0

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: When @NKingofDC was diagnosed with vocal-cord paralysis he lost his voice—and gained a new ability to listen. Just a lovely essay on the voices we don’t always hear: https://t.co/YCQnxhwrye
